variables.value: [強化/きょうか]・[育成/いくせい]

Players have seven core attributes:\nKick, Control, Technique, Intelligence, Pressure, Physical, and Agility.\nThese influence outcomes in Mini-Battles, for Special Moves, and other key gameplay moments.

Kick boosts a player's shooting ability and is especially important for Forwards.\nIt increases Shot Attack (Shot AT) and Focus Battle Attack (Focus AT),\nmaking it the go-to stat for scoring more goals.

Control measures a player's ability to handle the ball and is important for all positions.\nIt adds bonuses to both Shot Attack (Shot AT) and Focus Battle Attack (Focus AT),\nmaking it essential for advancing the ball from midfield to scoring positions.
Technique reflects how well a player competes for the ball and is key for Midfielders.\nIt boosts both Focus Battle Attack and Defence (Focus AT & DF),\nhelping your team keep control in midfield.

Intelligence reflects a player's football IQ and tactical awareness.\nIt adds bonuses to Focus Battle Defence (Focus DF) and Scramble Attack/Defence (Scramble AT & DF),\ngreatly influencing the player's ability to win the ball.
Pressure shows how well a player disrupts opponents in close\nchallenges. It boosts Scramble DF for possession battles and\nstrengthens Castle Wall DF and KP to help block shots.
Physical is all about raw strength.\nIt improves Keeper Power (KP) and Castle Wall Defence (Castle Wall DF),\nhelping with goal defence and powering through physical plays.
Agility measures how fast and reactive a player is, especially for goalkeepers.\nIt boosts Keeper Power (KP) and Focus Defence (Focus DF), directly improving their shot-stopping ability.

AT & DF represent Offence (AT) and Defence (DF) in Mini-Battles.\nThese values are calculated based on the seven basic attributes.\nIn Mini-Battles, the one with the higher AT or DF value wins their respective confrontation.
Shot AT represents shot power and is the combined total of a player's Kick and Control values.\nSpecial Moves or Shot Chains increase the Shot AT for the shot during which they are used.
These values determine the outcome of Focus Battles.\nFocus Attack (AT) is affected by Technique, Control, and Kick, while\nFocus Defence (DF) is affected by Technique, Intelligence, and Agility.

These values represent the offensive and defensive strength used to determine the outcome of Scrambles.\nScramble Attack (AT) is calculated as the sum of Intelligence and Physical,\nwhereas Scramble Defence (DF) is the sum of Intelligence and Pressure.

This value indicates the durability of the Castle Wall defence.\nIt is calculated as the sum of Physical and Pressure. When the ball hits a Castle Wall,\nits Shot Attack (AT) is reduced by an amount equal to the Castle Wall's Defence (DF) value.
Focus Battles, Scrambles, and Zones are collectively referred to as Mini-Battles.
When a player makes contact with an opponent in possession of the ball,\na Focus Battle starts. This one-on-one contest decides ball control.\nWinning gives a big boost to your Tension gauge.
A clash for the ball that occurs when the ball lands near players of both teams.\nYou can choose to keep it with the receiver or pass straight to a teammate.
Tension is the energy behind Special Moves.\nIf it falls below 30%, you won't be able to trigger effects like Breaches or Saves.\nYour Tension level shows as an orange bar at the top-left.
Press <CMD_ZONE_RUN:11> near either goal to activate the Zone mechanic.\nTime slows down, letting you give precise instructions,\nbut you'll need to act before time runs out.
The Zone Area refers to the area near the goal.\nWhen you enter this area, Zone Area will appear in the top-left corner of the screen.\nWithin this area, either team can activate the Zone mechanic.
While in a Zone, you can use a Special Move that targets a teammate.\nIf they follow up with their own Special Move to go for a goal,\nthe shot becomes stronger than a regular Special Move.
Shots on goal can be stopped by positioning players along the ball's trajectory.\nOnly certain Special Moves are capable of blocking shots.
KP, your goalkeeper's defence, is affected by Physical, Agility, and\nPressure, and drops equal to the power of shots stopped.\nIf at zero, your keeper cannot stop shots.
A Breach may trigger when the goalkeeper attempts to stop a shot.\nThe user's remaining Tension and the shot's AT determine how much KP is reduced.\nThe Tension used is consumed upon activation.
A Save can reliably stop any shot, no matter how powerful, without reducing KP.\nThe chance of activation can be increased through the player's abilities or tactics.

Fatigue accumulates each time the goalkeeper blocks an opponent's shot.\nAs fatigue increases, it reduces the goalkeeper's Defence (DF) when performing Keeper Moves.\nFatigue is indicated by a droplet-shaped icon displayed beneath the KP gauge at the top of the screen.

Bond Power accumulates as you successfully pass the ball to your teammates.\nWhen a shot is taken, this power adds a bonus to the shot's Attack (AT) value.\nThe current Bond Power is displayed as a percentage in the top-left corner of the screen.

Slide Tackles and Evades are actions used to contest possession of the ball.\nYou can perform these by pressing <CMD_ZONE_ACTION:11> near an opponent who currently controls the ball.\nNote that Slide Tackles carry a risk of committing a foul.

When defending in the Zone, your team can form Castle Walls\nnear the goal to block opposing players' dribbles, passes, and shot trajectories.\nCastle Walls only become effective once your designated players have reached their assigned positions.
Hold <CMD_DASH:11> while moving to dash at high speed. Dashing uses stamina.\nWhen stamina runs out, wait for it to recover before dashing again.

Press <CMD_DASH_ATTACK:11> while dashing on offence to perform a Power Dash.\nThis allows you to charge into an opponent and knock them back without entering a Focus Battle.\nHowever, it consumes a large amount of stamina and carries a risk of committing a foul.
Dangerous plays or some Special Moves can be called fouls, giving possession to the other team.\nIf the play is too dangerous, a yellow card may be issued as a warning.

A Throw-In occurs when the ball crosses the sideline.\nPlay restarts by throwing the ball back into the pitch from the sideline.\nUse the cursor to select a teammate, then press <CMD_PASS_01:11> to throw the ball.

Goal Kicks occur when the ball crosses the defending team's goal line\nafter last being touched by an attacking player.\nUse the cursor to select the target teammate for the kick, then press <CMD_PASS_01:11> to take the kick.

A Corner Kick is awarded when the ball crosses the defending team's goal line\nafter last being touched by a defending player.\nUse the cursor to select the target teammate for the kick, then press <CMD_PASS_01:11> to take the kick.
Free Kicks are awarded when an opposing player commits a foul during regular play.\nTo take a Free Kick, move the cursor using <FCMD_MOVE:11> to aim, then press <CMD_PASS_01:11> to kick.

Penalty Kicks for the attacking team occur when an opposing player commits a foul inside the penalty area.\nThe kicker selects a shot direction using <FCMD_MOVE:11>, then presses <CMD_PASS_01:11> to shoot.

Penalty Kicks against your team occur when a teammate commits a foul inside the penalty area.\nControl the goalkeeper to anticipate the shot direction and block the ball.\nMove the goalkeeper with <FCMD_MOVE:11> and use <CMD_ZONE_ACTION:11> to attempt a save.
A yellow card may be issued to a player who commits a foul.\nIf the same player receives two yellow cards during the match,\nthey are given a red card.
A red card is issued for actions judged to be extremely dangerous.\nThe player is immediately sent off and cannot be substituted.\nThe team must continue playing with one less player.
Player substitutions and position changes can be made from the Formation screen.\nThis screen is only accessible when the game is paused, such as during set plays or at halftime.

After a substitution, the morale of the team increases.\nThe substituted player receives a 15% boost to AT and DF for 60 seconds.\nPlayers in the same position as the substituted player receive a 5% boost to AT and DF.

An offside offence occurs when an attacking player receives a pass while in the opponent's half\nand is closer to their goal line than both the ball\nand the second-last defender when the pass is made.
Formations decide player positions on the pitch, with multiple patterns to choose from.\nYour formation affects each player's role and shapes your team's tactical style.

Power Charges and Power Blocks are risky moves that can foul\nbut let you counter an opponent's Special Move without using Tension.\nYou can only use them in response to an opponent's Special Move during a Focus Battle.
A Tension-free Dribble Move used during a Focus Battle on offence when the opponent uses a Special Move.\nIt doesn't cost Tension but risks a foul.
A Tension-free Block Move used during a Focus Battle on defence when the opponent uses a Special Move.\nIt doesn't cost Tension but risks a foul.
Special Moves are powerful abilities that cost Tension when used.\nThey come in four types: Shot, Dribble, Block, and Catch.\nOnce activated, a Special Move goes on cooldown for a short time.
Press <CMD_UPDATE_CHARA_CMD_LIST_LEFT:11> <CMD_UPDATE_CHARA_CMD_LIST_RIGHT:11> to switch between pages of Special Move commands.
Tactics are strategic commands from the Manager that affect the whole pitch or specific players.\nThey add depth and come as Special or Super Tactics.
Special Tactics boost individual players. When a player is inside a marked zone called a Geoglyph,\nthey get extra bonuses on top of the base effects.
Super Tactics are powerful strategies gained randomly during a match.\nThey affect all your players but only last for that match.
Press <CMD_CATCH_BOMB:11> on defence to trigger Focus Field.\nIf an opponent with the ball enters the zone around you, a Focus Battle starts.\nGreat for long-range challenges.
On offence, pressing <CMD_GO_AHEAD:11> commands your whole team to push forward the front line.\nUse this to play aggressively and keep up the pressure.

During Focus Battles, <CMD_FOCUS_AUTO_RUN_LEFT:11> and <CMD_FOCUS_AUTO_RUN_RIGHT:11> are used to direct
breakthroughs or defence to the left and right.
Once issued, the player will carry out the action automatically,
but just like manual control, it can still fail.

Once you enter Focus, you can't enter it again for a few seconds.\nIf you win at Focus, during this brief cooldown colliding with enemy players\ncan knock them back slightly, allowing you to delay their movement strategically.
In the Offensive Zone, some spots will make the cursor glow orange.\nAim at these spots when shooting to earn a bonus to your Shooting AT.
This represents a player's rarity rank.\nHigher ranks provide benefits such as unlocking new skills and increasing attributes.
Spirits are cards that contain a player's power.\nBy fusing Spirits with a player, you can increase that player's rarity.\nAdditionally, Spirits can be used to summon the corresponding player.
Each team can appoint one Manager to serve as its leader.\nLike players, Managers can learn skills that support\nand enhance the performance of the entire team.
Players and Special Moves belong to one of four elements:\nWind, Forest, Fire, or Mountain.\nEach element has strengths and weaknesses against the others.

Wind is strong against Mountain, Mountain is strong against Fire,\nFire is strong against Forest, and Forest is strong against Wind.\nUnderstanding these relationships is key to maximizing effectiveness in matches.
Players have Passive Skills that activate automatically when conditions are met.\nOnly players on the pitch can trigger these effects.\nSome Passives boost the player, others help the whole team.
Passive abilities with similar effects share the same symbol.\nBuilding a team with players who share that symbol\nmakes it easier to unleash their full potential.

When a player levels up, their base attributes will increase, and they may also learn new Special Moves.\nEach player has a unique growth pattern, meaning the rate and manner of their development will vary.
The Team Dock manages all parts of your team setup:\nplayer positions, Manager and Coordinator roles, Special Tactics, and Spirit selection.\nIt's your central hub for team configuration.
The Player Bank stores players not assigned to the Team Dock.\nIt maintains a complete record of all players you've collected.\nYou can move players freely between the Bank and the Team Dock.

WIN Treasures are special items that can be obtained with a fixed probability when you win\nFocus Battles or Scrambles. The items you collect from WIN Treasures can be used to develop\nyour players or exchanged for items in the shop.

Hero Tokens are unique tokens awarded as match rewards or obtained through WIN Treasures.\nBy collecting these tokens, you can exchange them for rare skill books,\nequipment, and other valuable items.

Ranked Match is a mode where you compete against players of similar rank.\nYour rank is classified into four tiers: Local, National, Continental, and Worldwide.\nYour rank will rise or fall depending on the results of your matches.
If you go three days without playing a Ranked Match,\npoints will start to be deducted daily from the fourth day onward.\nDemotion is limited to a maximum of one rank.
Ranks are determined each season.\nAt the end of a season, your rank is adjusted down by one.\nRewards are granted for completing the season in Worldwide or Continental Rank.
Lobby Match allows you to compete in matches hosted in player-created lobbies.\nWhen joining a lobby, you can select from several options, including\nAnyone, Rank-Specific, or Password Protected.
Win a Focus Battle with a Special Move to boost your next shot's power.\nThe boost stacks up to three times, growing stronger each time.\nUsing a Special Move on that shot costs less Tension.

The bigger the level gap between you and your opponent, the bigger your experience bonus after the match.\nThis bonus shows as a percentage on the match start screen\nso you know exactly what you'll get before the game begins.
If you think you can't win, you can choose to concede and end the match early.\nYou'll keep any items you earned so far but won't get any experience points from that game.

If a disconnection is judged intentional or due to an unstable connection,\nit counts as an improper disconnection.\nYou'll lose any items earned, the match counts as a loss, and your opponent wins right away.

This rule kicks in when a match ends in a tie, so the game won't end in a draw.\nInstead, the winner is decided by total shots, Focus Battle wins, and ball possession.\nYou can turn this rule on or off in the lobby match settings.
Press <CMD_ACT|11> to talk to characters or investigate points of interest.\n This is the basic action command used throughout the game.\nIf you're unsure what to do next, try pressing <CMD_ACT|11>.

You can find blue footballs scattered around the map. Kick one by pressing <CMD_ACT:11>.\nWhen the ball stops, it drops an item at that spot.\nOccasionally, golden footballs appear containing rare items.

You can acquire information by talking to NPCs or investigating points of interest throughout the world.\nAll collected information is stored in the Intelligence Bookmarks section of the menu,\nwhere you can explore and analyze it in greater detail.
Some NPCs have a [$gaiji_icon_present01] icon above their heads.\nApproaching and speaking to these characters for the first time\nwill reward you with a one-time item.
You can receive various side quests from NPCs marked with [$gaiji_icon_quest01].\nQuest destinations appear on the map as [$gaiji_icon_story01].
Press <CMD_MAP_MENU:11> to bring up the map.\nSelecting icons on the map allows you to fast travel to those locations\nor to check the objectives and progress of any quests you have accepted.

Press <CMD_MENU:11> to bring up the main menu. From here, you can manage player training,\nadjust team formations, organize items, review Intelligence Bookmarks, access Data Files,\nchange settings, and consult the Help section.
When you attack, the Tension gauge in the upper left corner of the screen will fill up.\nWhen full, you can use a powerful Finishing Blow,\na strike so mighty it almost feels unfair. Almost.
Sometimes, enemies will use a Sweet Attack that can one-shot your characters.\nWhen the countdown begins, choose the command that wins based on the rock-paper-scissors rules.
Breaches, Saves, and Miscalculations sometimes occur during battles.\nBreach is a lucky hit that deals more damage than usual.\nSave is a flash of insight that completely blocks an enemy's attack.
Miscalculation occurs when you let your guard down for a moment and let your opponents step in.\nIt makes you take more damage than usual, so be careful.

Action Stones indicate the number of possible actions.\nThey decrease when you select a command but recover over time.\nIf stones remain, you can issue commands without waiting for the enemy's attack.
Some characters can use Castle Walls to defend.\nAttack the wall with the personality trait shown on it to break it.
While exploring, you may come across special objects.\nAs you discover new things, relevant keywords are automatically added\nto your Intelligence Bookmarks in the main menu.
Outwit and overcome anyone who stands in your way!\nThat's how we battle this time! But if you firmly embrace\nfootball in your heart, the type of battle might even change!
To deliver an effective blow to your opponent, pay attention to their hands.\nIf you select the rock-paper-scissors command that beats\ntheir selected command, you can deal significant damage.
You can use a recovery item with <CMD_ITEM:11>.\nUsing recovery early is the key to winning many battles.
Press <CMD_SYSTEM_PAUSE:11> during battle to momentarily pause.\nIf your opponent is too quick, use this to get a breather and\ncome up with a plan to counterattack!
You can use a recovery item with <CMD_ITEM:11>.\nUsing recovery early is the key to winning many battles.
Pass when <FLC:KISOJI> gives you the signal!\nPay attention to where he's pointing and the indicator lights to know where to pass.\nYou'll have to try again if you pass at the wrong time.
Choose the rock-paper-scissors command that beats your opponent's command.\nIf you do, you will deal significant damage to them!\nBut you won't deal much damage if you draw or lose.
Press <CMD_AREA_MAP_MENU:11> to bring up the Area Map.\nThis view shows your current location\nand detailed information about the surrounding area.
The [$gaiji_icon_story01] icon indicates the destination for quests,\nwhile the [$gaiji_icon_btl01] icon marks battle locations.\nUse these icons to find places of interest.
Press <CMD_MAP_MENU:11> to bring up the Overhead Map.\nSelecting a [$gaiji_map_marker01] pin lets you move directly\nto that location or review the details of any ongoing quests.
Approach a blue glowing football and a phantom player will appear.\nPass to the player to complete the challenge!\nPay attention to ball's trajectory to ensure the pass connects.
Special training is key to developing your players.\nThere are many types to try, so keep at it!
Special training gives bonus experience based on the elements.\nBy figuring out which elements are most effective,\nyou can level up your players more efficiently.
You cannot attempt the same Special Training Battle repeatedly in succession.\nEither wait for the gauge to refill or try a different Special Training instead.
Use tokens earned from Special Training Battles and other activities\nto trade for equipment and other useful items.
You can change the equipment of your characters through the Team Dock to improve their attributes.\nSome equipment also changes a player's outfit.
You can pet the cats at the school or around town.\nGood things may happen if you do, but persistent petting might irritate them.
Press <CMD_KIZUNA_SCREEN_CAPTURE:11> to take a photo.\nYou can adjust the camera angle and characters' poses as you see fit.\nThese photos can also be used in the Bond Link feature.
You can view or delete photos you've taken in\nMain Menu > Save > Photo Management.
An NPC with a [$gaiji_icon_ear01] icon has something worth hearing.\nTalk to them—they might offer helpful advice or hints.
A social media platform used by <FST:UNMEI> and the others.\nNew posts will appear as the story progresses or certain conditions are met.
A notification will appear\nwhen you have unread messages.
At certain points in the story, fast travel via the world map\nmay be temporarily restricted. This limitation will be lifted\nonce you progress further in the story.

This phase starts before a Story Progression Match.\nEach chapter has training objectives like boosting player attributes or learning new Special Moves.\nYou need to complete these tasks to keep progressing.
Complete all Special Training objectives to\nunlock a major story match that pushes the plot forward.\nOpen the Quest menu to get started.
In Story Progression Matches, your team's Formation, Tactics,\nand required team members are fixed.
Specific objectives are set for these matches.\nYou must complete them all to clear the match and move the story forward.

During the football tryouts, you get to choose 5 players from a pool of 15 candidates.\nPlayers not selected during this phase will be unavailable for scouting until after you complete the game,\nso choose wisely.

As the story progresses, there will be moments when you temporarily control characters\nother than <FST:UNMEI>. During these periods,\ncertain features such as Quests and Focus Squabbles will be unavailable.
A small aircraft that shuttles you between <MNT:NAGUMOHARA> and the Odaiba Football Gardens via the Skyport.\nUse it to return for training or scouting anytime.
Students available for scouting are marked with a Bond Clover icon.\nBuilding a stronger bond with them will gradually fill a gauge,\nand once it's full, you'll be able to recruit them to your team.
To build stronger bonds, talk to students regularly, \ngive them items they like, and meet special conditions.

Interacting with <FUL:UMIBOZU> Statues lets you change the in-game time.\nStudents you can scout only show up on specific days and times.\nCheck each student's info in the Data Files to know when to meet them.
Players can't be placed in their usual positions during these drills.\nShake things up and enjoy a match with a twist!
Completing Story Mode unlocks additional bonus content.\nThis content remains unlocked even if you start a new playthrough using Re-Story.
Auto-battle is available in all non-story battles by pressing <CMD_CHANGE_PLAYER_AUTO_BTL_MODE:11>.\nHowever, Finishing Blows and Healing actions must still be\nperformed manually.
During battles, opponents who heal others may appear.\nThese characters give off a green glow.\nTo prevent the battle from lasting too long, prioritize defeating them first.
These are small quests that provide rewards upon completion.\nYou can try various actions such as helping people in need,\nengaging in battles, taking photos, and more.
You can access activities from Data Files in the menu.\nGive them a try!
Students you successfully scout will be registered here.\nAfter clearing Story Mode, this list will be merged\nwith the Player Bank used in other game modes.

Football Battles are 5-on-5 mini matches played on a smaller pitch with shorter match times than regular matches.\nNeither offside rules nor out-of-bounds rules apply,\nmeaning no throw-ins, goal kicks, or corner kicks.

Allows you to access Special Training Battles that help boost your players' attributes.\nYou can also use these portals to travel between training spots\nor visit the Special Training Shop to trade for equipment and other items.
Here you can practice fundamental match actions such as\nFocus Battles, Passing, and Sliding Tackles repeatedly,\nallowing you to hone your skills through repetition.
Focus Battles are one-on-one confrontations that simulate localized skirmishes within a match.\nVictory is determined by the player's quick, decisive choices.
During Focus Battles, <CMD_FOCUS_AUTO_RUN_LEFT:11> and <CMD_FOCUS_AUTO_RUN_RIGHT:11> are used to aim \nbreakthroughs or defend to the left and right.\nOr, you can just let the game play for you.
If you run into an opponent's Defending Hand, they will take the ball from you.\nTo avoid this, try dashing diagonally to slip around the outside of their reach.
You can steal the ball by forcing the opponent into your Defending Hand.\nUse quick side steps to keep the opponent directly in front of you and maintain control.
Zones are shooting battles that take place when either team's goal is approached.\nBecause these moments play out in slow motion,\nmaintaining a broad awareness of the field is essential.
If your shot hits the opponent's Castle Wall, its power will be reduced.\nInstead, pass the ball to a teammate who is open, then take your shot.
Blocking a shot with your Castle Wall will weaken it. If the opponent passes the ball,\nquickly reposition your Castle Wall using a nearby player to keep your defence solid.
Improving your passing skills is essential. Before the opponent can intercept the ball,\ncomplete a sequence of three consecutive passes to break through their defensive line.
When an opponent gets too close, it becomes more difficult to make a successful pass.\nRemain calm and carefully look for open teammates to pass to.

Sliding Tackles allow you to steal the ball directly without entering a Focus Battle.\nIf you succeed, your team gains possession and can transition to offence.\nHowever, there is a risk that the tackle may be called as a foul.

Approach your opponent and perform a Sliding Tackle as straight on as possible.\nTackling from too far away makes it easier for the opponent to avoid your attempt.\nAdditionally, sliding tackles from the side or behind have a higher risk of being called as fouls.
Focus Field allows you to draw opponents within a wide area into a Focus Battle.\nEven opponents at a distance can be forced into a one-on-one\nconfrontation using this technique.
Because Focus Field spreads rapidly over a large area,\nuse it proactively as soon as you get close to your opponents.\nIt is effective even against opponents attempting to escape by dashing.
Practice football without any time limits and train at your own pace.\nPress the <CMD_FUNC1> when you're ready to end the session.\nSteady practice leads to victory.
Finish your noodles before they get soggy!\nWatch the shopkeeper's hand in the top left corner\nand play the winning rock-paper-scissors move to gain the advantage.
Finish before the noodles get soggy\nto earn a buff that boosts your training.\nFor maximum effect, train right after Noodle Battles.
During dance battles, wait until the shrinking circle\noverlaps with the ring-shaped zone, then press the indicated button.
Missing the timing causes you to lose HP.\nIf your HP drops to zero, the Dance Battle ends in failure.\nAim to keep your timing precise and achieve a high score.
During dance battles, wait until the shrinking circle\noverlaps with the ring-shaped zone, then press the indicated button.

If the circle leaves the success zone before you press the button, it counts as a miss and you lose HP.\nAdditionally, your HP will decrease at certain points during training.\nIf your HP reaches zero, the Special Training will fail.
Special Training can raise the attributes of up to 16 team members at once.\nTrain your players simultaneously to develop your team more efficiently.
You cannot attempt the same Special Training Battle repeatedly in succession.\nEither wait for the gauge to refill or try a different Special Training instead.
You can fast travel to any Special Training Portal you have previously discovered.\nTry various types of training to improve your players' attributes efficiently.

Pass the ball when the tryout candidate signals for it.\nPay attention to where they're pointing and the indicator lights to know where to pass.\nYou'll have to try again if you pass at the wrong time.
Engage in practice matches against other teams using the same rules as Football Frontier.\nThis mode provides an opportunity to train effectively under realistic game conditions.

You can choose which background music plays during Special Training sessions.\nNew theme songs will unlock as you progress through the story.\nThis feature becomes available after you complete a training at the Special Training Portal.

Select Football Battle at the Special Training Portal to participate in 5-on-5 matches\nagainst various clubs within <MNT:NAGUMOHARA> or other school teams.\nThese portals are also accessible via Fast Travel during training sessions.
Every story match come with set objectives.\nYou must complete them all to clear the match and move the\nstory forward.
When you set a Side Quest as your Current Quest,\nits objective will appear at the top-left corner of the screen.\nThe quest's destination will also be marked on the map.
To change your Current Quest, press <CMD_ACT|11> while viewing the Side Quests list.
You can create a team for each Team Dock.\nSwitching the active Team Dock will also change the default team\nthat participates in matches.
Each character has an aptitude as a player, manager, or coordinator.\nMeeting certain conditions lets you unlock additional aptitudes beyond the initial one.
Once the conditions are met, you can change a character's aptitude on the Abilearn Board,\nallowing you to freely customize your team composition.
You can assign up to three backup members to your team.\nLike players, they can learn skills that support\nand enhance the performance of the entire team.
Some special players cannot be obtained through enhancement.\nTheir moves and skills cannot be changed, but they are extremely strong.\nOnly two can be fielded in a match at a time.
These are gameplay objectives designed to help you learn football mechanics.\nComplete the displayed tasks to get a handle on the controls.
Press <CMD_FUNCL1:11><CMD_FUNCR1:11> while in the Team Dock to switch decks.\nBe sure to configure your top lineups for all three decks:\nRPG Battle, Football Battle, and Matches.
Press <CMD_FUNCL1:11> <CMD_FUNCR1:11> while viewing the map\nto switch between <MNT:NAGUMOHARA> and Odaiba Football Gardens\nfor fast travel.
Replay the story from the beginning while retaining your levels, so you can continue improving your team.\nMajor story matches will scale in difficulty based on your current level.

While in a match, press <CMD_CHANGE_SPECIAL_TACTICS_CMD_MODE:11> + <CMD_SUPER_TACTICS_RUN_01:11>, <CMD_SPECIAL_TACTICS_RUN_01:11>, <CMD_SPECIAL_TACTICS_RUN_03:11> or <CMD_SPECIAL_TACTICS_RUN_02:11>\nto activate pre-set tactics.
You can activate Keyman Lockdown by targeting an opposing\nplayer with the cursor ring and choosing to lock them down.
Move the player left or right with <FCMD_MOVE:11> to return the ball.\nKeep the ball's path within your defensive range.
When a powerful shot comes your way,\nuse <FCMD_MOVE:11> to predict where it will land and <CMD_SUPER_TACTICS_RUN_01:11> to catch it.
Use the cursor to signal when a player should trap the ball.\nThe player in front of the cursor will take control of it.
Send as many balls through the tire as you can within the time limit.\nPress the button corresponding to the player to shoot.\nTiming is key—watch the tire's position and rotation carefully.
Control the <FUL:UMIBOZU> to oversee your players' training.\nAttack any player who loses focus to maintain their performance.
Drag the heavy tires across the sand!\nPress <CMD_SLED_DASH_DECIDE_L1:11> and <CMD_SLED_DASH_DECIDE_R1:11> alternately when they light up\nto dash ahead and claim first place!

Unexpected obstacles may appear along the course.\nColliding with them will shake your tire and cost you time.\nWhen a miscreant blocks your way, press <CMD_SLED_DASH_DECIDE_R_RIGHT:11> to kick them aside.
Dribble your way through the designated checkpoints.\nPress the button at the right time to dodge the <FUL:UMIBOZU> blocking your path.
Switch between three dash speeds to run\nup and down the Hecaton Stairway as fast as you can!\nIf you finish last, the training will be considered a failure.
Running at high speed drains your stamina gauge,\nand you'll start to lose breath once it's empty.\nSo, remember to pace yourself carefully!
In a 1-on-1 zone with the opposing GK, normal shots\ngain a temporary power boost.\nPassing or using a Special Move cancels the effect.
Usually awarded after a foul.\nLets you take a direct shot on goal.
Usually awarded for offsides.\nYou must pass to a teammate and can't take the shot directly.
If your player greatly outmatches the opponent, you can knock\nthem back on contact without triggering a Focus Battle.\nAlso blocks enemy Focus Fields.
A Shot Move that activates in response to an opponent's shot.\nIf your AT is higher, the ball powers up and rebounds straight\ntoward the opponent's goal.

When in possession of the ball, move with <FCMD_MOVE:11> to dribble.\nUse <FCMD_MOVE:11> to change the trajectory and pass to a player by pressing <CMD_PASS_01:11>.\nYou will then control the character who received the pass.
A Focus Battle is a mini-battle for the ball that occurs when the\nplayer in possession of the ball comes into contact with an opponent.
If your player has the ball, control them to break through upwards and win the Focus. \nThis will free your player while maintaining possession of the ball.
Break through the opponent's defence, indicated by reaching hands, by pressing <CMD_FOCUS_BATTLE_BREAKTHROUGH:11>.\nAfter an amount of time, you can exit the Focus Battle by passing.
To steal the ball, use <FCMD_MOVE:11> and <CMD_FOCUS_BATTLE_DASH:11> to approach the opponent.\nIf you come within a certain range of them,\nyou will steal the ball and win the Focus Battle.
When the ball comes close to players of both teams,\nScramble takes place, which is a mini-battle for possession\nof the ball that relies on timing.
Move the cursor to a player's icon and press <CMD_PASS_01:11> when the circle\nreaches the center. Successfully gaining possession depends on\nplayer abilities and accuracy of timing.
Tension is the power required to use special moves,\nshown by the orange gauge on the top left of the screen.\nTension can be gained by winning Focus Battles or Scrambles.
Press <CMD_ZONE_ACTION:11> when near an opponent in possession of the ball to\nperform a Slide Tackle. Slide Tackles can immediately let you\nsteal the ball, but can also lead to a foul.
When dribbling, you can evade Slide Tackles from the opponent with <CMD_ZONE_ACTION:11>.\nTension is consumed when Evasion is successful.
Plays such as Slide Tackle and Power Charge may result in a foul.\nFouling players may receive a yellow card. If they receive two\nyellow cards, they are given a red card and will be dismissed.
A team with a dismissed player must continue playing with one less player.\nA dismissed player can not be substituted, so be careful.
When near either team's goal area, press <CMD_ZONE_RUN:11> to activate a Zone.\nDuring a Zone, the pace of the game slows down, allowing\nmore precise shooting or defending commands.

During an offensive Zone near the opposition's goal area,\nyou can move the cursor to select a target to shoot or pass to and press <CMD_PASS_01:11>\nto execute the command. You can also choose to use a move.

In an offensive Zone, move the cursor onto an ally player and press <CMD_PASS_01:11>\nto pass to them, shifting to their point of view. Selecting to shoot\nbefore they receive the ball results in a more powerful Direct Shot.
You can aim a Shooting Move at an ally instead of the goal.\nThe receiving player can then choose another Shooting Move to\ninitiate a Shot Chain, greatly increasing the power of the shot.
In a defensive Zone which happens when the opposition invades\nyour goal area, you can place Castle Walls to stop their shots.

Move cursor with <FCMD_MOVE:11> and press <CMD_FOCUS_BATTLE_PREP_BLOCK:11> to designate the placement area.\nThe closest player will move towards the designated area and\nupon arrival, put up the Castle Wall to block shots.
A maximum of two Castle Walls can be placed at the same time.\nDesignating placement for a third Castle Wall will cancel the\nfirst Castle Wall placed or designated.
The goalkeeper's defence is displayed by the Keeper Power (KP) gauge.\nThe goalkeeper loses KP with each shot stopped, and\ncannot stop any more shots once KP reaches zero.
When the power of the player's shot exceeds the goalkeeper's KP,\nthe shot will score. Use Keeper Moves to slow the rate of KP depletion.
When an ally's shot reaches the opponent goalkeeper while Tension is above 30%, \nBreach activates with a certain probability.\nThis probability is called Breach rate and is 10% by default.

Breach uses remaining Tension as Breach Power to face off against the opposing goalkeeper.\nIt will shave off a percentage of KP equal to the remaining Tension.\nIf the opponent's KP is reduced to zero by the sum of your shot AT and Breach Power, you score a goal.
Tension converted into Breach Power will be consumed if a goal is scored.\nBreach activating is an excellent chance for a comeback.
When the ally keeper tries to stop the opponent's shot while\nTension is above 30%, Save activates with a certain probability.\nThis probability is called Save rate and is 10% by default.
When Save activates, the goalkeeper will completely block the shot,\nregardless of how much power the shot has.\nAdditionally, KP will not decrease.

AT/DF influence the outcome of mini-battles like Focus Battles.\nAT represents total offensive power and DF represents total defensive power.\nA higher value equals a greater advantage during mini-battles.
AT/DF values are calculated using players' seven attributes,\nand the more a player grows, the higher their numbers will be.
When dribbling, choose a direction with <CMD_DASH:11> while holding  <FCMD_MOVE:11>,\nthen press <CMD_PASS_01:11> to dash, allowing you to move at high speeds.
If a player comes into contact with an opponent while dashing,\nthe player can scatter them but may also\nreceive a foul for a Rough Attack.
Repeatedly passing to ally players will build Bond Power, which adds\na bonus to the final Shot AT. Bond Power increases with each pass made,\nbut will gradually decrease when possession is lost.
Bond Power adds a bonus to the final power of the shot.\nIt can be stacked to a maximum of 30%.
You can consume Tension to use Special Moves in a variety of\nsituations. There are four types of Special Moves:\nShot Moves, Offence Moves, Defence Moves, and Goalkeep Moves.
Usage of Special Moves is restricted by their category. The message:\n"Outside Skill Area" is shown when players have an available Special Move\nbut aren't in a situation where they can use it.
There are other moves such as Long Shot, a shot made from a distance,\nor Shot Block, a block made in the goal area to a shot. When usable,\nmoves are automatically shown in the command wheel.
After Special Moves are used, they go on a cooldown before they can\nbe used again. Cooldowns timers are specific to the move and\nare shown by the circular icon by the Special Move name.

Hold <CMD_CHANGE_SPECIAL_TACTICS_CMD_MODE:11> to bring up the Tactics menu and choose between one of\nthree preset Tactics or Super Tactics with the <CMD_SPECIAL_TACTICS_RUN_01:11><CMD_SPECIAL_TACTICS_RUN_02:11><CMD_SPECIAL_TACTICS_RUN_03:11><CMD_SPECIAL_TACTICS_RUN_04:11> buttons.
Depending on the activated Tactic, a corresponding Geoglyph will\nappear on the pitch, consequently serving as a tactical indicator.
Players on a Geoglyph will receive buffs unique to each Tactic.\nUtilize these buffs to swing the match in your favor.\nTactics also trigger additional effects regardless of the Geoglyph.
Super Tactics are special Tactics that confer effects to all your\nplayers. One Special Tactic is available at the start of the match,\nbut you can potentially get more by winning mini-battles.

Press <CMD_ZONE_RUN:11> to lob the ball in the direction you're moving.\nHold the button to send the ball farther.\nUse this technique strategically, judging the situation carefully to maximize its effect.
In this mode, the players take full control while you watch the match unfold.\nPress <CMD_FUNCR1> to switch between Cinematic and Free Camera views.
Press <CMD_KIZUNA_SCREEN_CAPTURE:11> while in Commander Mode or while the game is paused to take photos.\nDon't wanna miss immortalizing those epic moments!
In Lobby Matches, two players take turns controlling players and Power-Up Sigil together.\nControl switches whenever the opponent steals the ball.
Legendary squads from Inazuma Eleven history are ready and waiting!\nJump in and start a match anytime.
Holding the ball too long without advancing counts as time-wasting.\nThe crowd boos, and players become more likely to make passing errors.

In this mode, you can watch the match from any angle, just like a real manager.\nPress <CMD_DOWN:11> to switch between Manual Mode and Commander Mode.\nThis mode cannot be used the first time you face a new team.
Use collected Bond Stars to unlock Spirits.\nSpend 5 Bond Stars at once to get 12 random Spirits.
Bond Stars are needed to acquire Spirits in the Player Universe.\nYou use these stars to unlock constellations,\nand earn them by winning battles in Chronicle Mode.
Short for Ability Learning Board. This feature allows you to unlock skill trees,\nenabling you to choose and customize each player's development path.
Accessed from the Team Dock's player menu.\nSet skills, switch growth paths, and shape your players' development.
Put Training Beans into the Abilearn Board to raise a player's base stats.\nYou can also choose to have them auto-placed when obtained.
Materialize a Spirit to register the resulting player in the Player Bank.\nSummoned players are assigned a random Abilearn Board.
Strengthen your team by linking players with Bond Lines.\nThis increases the Bond Power gained from passes between those connected players.

In Bond Link,
place decorative items on the board and lines
to style them however you like.
Assign roles to players that influence their behavior in Commander Mode.\nFor instance, Ace Strikers get more passes near the goal,\nwhile Playmakers receive more passes in midfield.
The Libero role causes the player to participate more actively in both offence and defence,\nwhile Rough Players execute a higher number of Dashes and Sliding Tackles during play.
Equipping two or more copies of the same Special Move on the Abilearn Board will cause it to evolve.\nKeep evolving your moves to grow in power and take on even tougher opponents.
Moves come in three Evolution types: +1, V-, and L-Evolution.\nEach move belongs to one of these types.\nEvolve your moves to boost their strength and gain the edge in matches.
Each game mode, including Story Mode and Chronicle Mode,\nfeatures its own dedicated shop where you can purchase mode-specific items and upgrades.
Exchange Tokens unique to each game mode for rewards like Equipment and Secret Stones.\nThese Tokens can only be earned in their specific modes.
Reaching a certain level unlocks slots for Hyper Moves,\nallowing you to equip either a Hyper or a Special Move.
You can freely assign players' kit numbers.\nSome numbers may become fixed as the story progresses.
Goal celebrations can be customized for each character.\nEven if you don't change them,\nthey'll naturally match the character's personality.
Deleting a character permanently removes them from the Player Bank.\nThis action is irreversible and converts the character into a Spirit.\nSpirits obtained this way cannot be summoned.
A shop where you can trade specific Spirits for other Spirits or items.\nCheck back often to see what's available.
Press <CMD_CHANGE_EXEC_CHARA_CMD_MODE:11> while on the pitch to open the Special Move command menu,\nallowing you to execute Long Shots and Hyper Moves.
Hyper Moves are Special Moves that awaken a player's full power.\nThere are seven types of Hyper Moves: Keshin, Armourfied Keshin, Mix 'n' Match, Totems, Bond Transform,\nAwakening, and Mode Changes.
Hyper Moves used during a Focus Battle automatically win it.\nA Hyper Move can only be countered with another Hyper Move.
The Hyper Gauge powers Hyper Moves.\nIt fills gradually as you use Special Moves,\nwith Dribble and Defence Moves filling it faster.
A physical manifestation of a player's spiritual energy.\nActivating a Keshin buffs the whole team, not just the user.\nIt also lets the player perform powerful Special Moves called Keshin Moves.
Lets the player transform by merging with their Keshin.\nThis boosts the user and greatly powers up their Special Moves.
A transformation that fuses the user with a bonded teammate whose emotions and willpower align with theirs.\nIt grants strong buffs and enhances their Special Moves.
Draws out the primal beast inside the player to boost their abilities.\nThe user gets a long-lasting buff that grows stronger with each Focus Battle win.
This also lets you perform powerful Special Moves called Totem Strikes.

Borrow the power of a bonded teammate and take on their appearance and abilities.\nWhile transformed, all of your stats are replaced\nwith those of the player connected to you via the Bond Transform Line.
Unleash a player's hidden potential to power them up.\nThe user receives a buff, along with special effects\nbased on the specific type of Awakening activated.
Some especially powerful tactics have a chance to fail.
Tactics have several categories, each with unique strategic benefits:\nOffensive, Passing, Targeted Debuff, Team-wide Buff, and Debuff Geoglyph.
Offensive Tactics form dynamic setups around the ball carrier,\nhelping the team push forward quickly and pressure the opponent.
Pass Tactics alter passing routes to prevent interceptions,\nletting the ball move safely upfield.
Targeted Debuff Tactics apply specific debuffs to chosen\nplayers, reducing their effectiveness.
Team-wide Buff Tactics boost all your players on the pitch, improving overall team performance.
Debuff Geoglyph Tactics create Geoglyphs that debuff enemies.\nIf an opponent with the ball steps on one, you can trigger an effect to steal the ball.
Real Skills are Special Moves focused on finesse rather than power.\nThey're weaker than other moves but let you outsmart opponents with precise technique.
Some Real Shooting Skills can only be used if the final pass\nis at the correct height. Be sure to understand each move's traits\nso you can use them when it counts.
For example, a Low Drive can only be used as a direct shot\nwhen receiving a ground pass. Likewise, a Bounce Shot can only\nbe used as a direct shot when receiving a lofted pass.

Some players undergo sudden internal shifts that dramatically alter their personality and playstyle.\nThese changes may include becoming more aggressive or adopting a new demeanor,\nand their abilities are adjusted to match the new mode.

Press <CMD_CHANGE_AURA_SLOT_MODE_SPLIT_02:11> <CMD_CHANGE_AURA_SLOT_MODE_SPLIT_01:11> to access a shortcut menu for your registered Hyper Moves.\nYou can also use this to activate Hyper Moves from players you're not currently controlling.
You can register up to four Hyper Moves from your players for quick access during matches.\nSimply access Hyper Move Commands in the Team Dock menu to do so.
In addition to standard Passives, there are Manager Passives (for managers),\nCoordinator Passives (for coordinators),\nand Custom Passives that can be equipped to players.
To use Manager and Coordinator Passives,\nplay more matches to raise your match count\nand unlock the Manager/Coordinator Badge slots.
Custom Passives can be equipped once a slot is unlocked on the player's Abilearn Board.\nChoose abilities to enhance your players.
Press <CMD_ZONE_QUICK_ATTACH_CURSOR:11> <FCMD_ZONE_CURSOR_ASSIST:11> to quickly switch\nshots/pass targets while in the Offensive Zone.\n
Press <CMD_EVENT_AUTO_FORWARD_ON:11> during dialogue to enable automatic text progression.\nPress <CMD_EVENT_AUTO_FORWARD_ON:11> again to disable it.\n
You can swap a Fabled Player's moves,\nmaking them exceptionally versatile and effective in any lineup.\nHowever, only one may be fielded each match.
Relive the history of Inazuma Eleven, one step at a time.\nProgress through each node to uncover the full story.
Experience the story firsthand by replaying key moments.\nMeet the conditions of each History Check to unlock\nand relive numerous iconic scenes.
Challenge matches using your own custom team.\nWin a match to unlock the next node on the Chronicle Competition Route.
These have a higher drop rate for rare Spirits and items.\nWinning the match unlocks the Hero Battle for that node.
These have a low drop rate for Hero Spirits.\nWin the match to obtain a powerful character!
Each match has its own conditions. If you don't meet them,\nthe timeline breaks—and you'll have to try again.
Some stadiums feature unusual gimmicks that affect how players move.\nAdjust your strategy to overcome these challenges and win.
The Aerodrome Arena generates cyclones during matches.\nIf a player touches a marked Geoglyph on the pitch,\nthey will be blown away and drop the ball.
In the Ice Palace Arena, players receive a debuff that reduces their movement speed.\nIt also lowers their ball control when receiving passes.
The River Raft Arena experiences pitch-down effects.\nContact with a marked Geoglyph will cause players to be\nblown away and lose possession of the ball.
The Pinball Adventure Arena features flippers that deflect the ball.\nIf the ball enters a flipper's range, even Special Move shots will be bounced away.
The Shifting Sands Arena contains areas of quicksand.\nStanding on a marked Geoglyph will cause players to be\ndragged steadily in a fixed direction.
Certain battles allow you to choose between two allied teams to control.\nAlthough some teammates differ between these options,\nyou can switch your choice later and enjoy different story variations.
This is a mandatory battle that must be cleared to progress the story.\nMake sure your team is ready!
To keep Route Unlock Battles from becoming one-sided,\nyour players' levels will be scaled down\nif they're too high.
A desert world with lighter gravity than Earth.\nIts unusual atmosphere boosts Mountain-type special moves,\nso tailor your strategy to the terrain.
This water planet's heavy gravity and charged atmosphere amplify Wind-type special moves.\nStay sharp when enemies bring out wind-aligned techniques.
A high-gravity world where the atmosphere powers up Fire-type special moves.\nNatural gas vents cover the stadium, bouncing the ball back whenever it nears the boundary.
Lighter gravity and lush, verdant terrain define this world.\nIts atmosphere strengthens Forest-type special moves, rewarding those who adapt to its unique environment.
Though far from Earth, this planet feels surprisingly familiar.\nEven so, its distinct atmosphere enhances elementless special moves.
Use this to create your own unique player character.\nThe avatar you design can be controlled within the Bond Town\nand can also participate in matches.
Decorate your town with Bond Objects to make it uniquely yours.\nYou can invite friends to visit your town online,\nor drop by their towns to hang out and explore.
Place Bond Objects to raise your Inazuma Power.\nCollect objects and decorate your town to level up.
Allows up to 8 players to chat with emotes and stickers.\nSet up a Stadium and you can even battle each other!
Pick a theme to shape your town's look.\nEach one completely changes the scenery, so choose the vibe that fits your vision.
Town themes come with different terrain layouts,\nlike hills, rivers, and elevation changes,\nthat affect how your town is built.
Set the time of day for your town—day, evening, or night.\nEach choice changes the town's overall atmosphere.
Bond Objects come in all shapes and sizes and can be placed throughout your town.\nEarn them in Chronicle Mode battles, find them in shops or other places,\nand use them to bring your town to life.
This mode allows you to place and remove Bond Objects within your Bond Town.\nThere is a limit to how many objects of each size category you can place at once.

When you hold a Bond Object, potential placement spots will light up.\nSpots that glow blue indicate where you can place the object, while red glowing spots show that\nanother object already occupies that space and must be moved before placing the new item.
Press <CMD_RUN_CRAFT_WARP:11> while in Bond Town to move your avatar wherever you like.
You can place characters you have acquired within your Town.\nThey can be set to stand in your preferred locations or move freely throughout the Town.
Selecting "Roam" for a town member lets them move freely around your Town.\nThey will naturally gravitate toward objects they find interesting.
Some Bond Objects include Anchor Points,\ndesignated spots where characters can be placed directly.
Enable cats to visit your town,\nthen choose which ones you'd like to place and where.

You can communicate with others through chat, as well as by using Stickers and Emotes.\nPress <CMD_FUNC5:11> to display the cursor, and use <CMD_FUNCL2:11> and <CMD_STAMP_PALETTE_NEXT:11> to switch between command options.
Certain Bond Objects serve as interactive shops where you can\nexchange Bond Tokens for various items. You can also access\nthese shops directly from the main menu by selecting Bond Shop.
Place a stadium in your town to start matches.\nYou can also team up with friends and play together right from your stadium.
A special plant that blooms in your Bond Town under certain conditions.\nIt can be traded for valuable items at the Bond Shop.
You can change your avatar's appearance\nto that of your favorite character while in Bond Town.\nOnly characters you've unlocked are available.
This look only lasts while you're in town.\nYou'll revert to your normal appearance in matches and other modes.
Castle Wall Cursor Control/\nSwitch to Goalkeeper
